page.title: 06PUBLIC TRANSPORT IN GROVE.
page.content: The village of Grove is not served by any form of public transport,apart from the daily School Bus. A bus service between Retford and Tuxford stops on request about half a mile away,at the road junction between the Grove Village Road and the Retford / Nether Headon Road.The road through the village is used principally by local cars,agricultural vehicles , and by visitors to the Church and the Garden Centre.In the South-West of the region,the main East Coast Railway lies on an embankment.Traffic is almost entirely composed of High Speed '125' Expresses to and from London.Each day,about 40 expresses travel North.This section of the track has coloured light signalling and'continuous rail'.The installation of the electrification posts commenced this summer.
